column5: No gender in Ajagbe.

There is no grammatical gender system. Different words are used to distinguish male from female persons; to indicate whether an animal is male or female, a word for 'male' or 'female' is added to the noun.
This feature is preferably confirmed by another source.
No gender.
There are separate terms for masculine and feminine humans and animals, but these do not amount to a noun class system.

Noun roots refering to people may carry a meaning involving sex or may carry no sex reference. If the terms carrying the sex reference are used, then a sexual meaning is implied; otherwise the sex neutral terms are used. In Jaqaru, if one wishes to discuss sex, one can do so, easily and gracefully. If one wishes to discuss people without reference to sex, that also can be done [. . .] (Hardman, 2000: 12). The main nominal class system is limited to "human/non-human", refer to GB053 for more information.
